title: Vector Operations
description:
Practice common vector operations.

## Requirements

1. Implement `sum_vec(numbers: &[i32]) -> i32` - sum all numbers
2. Implement `find_max(numbers: &[i32]) -> Option<i32>` - find maximum value
3. Implement `remove_duplicates(numbers: Vec<i32>) -> Vec<i32>` - remove duplicates preserving order
4. Implement `rotate_left(numbers: &mut [i32], positions: usize)` - rotate array left

testCases.assertion: { let mut v = vec![1, 2, 3, 4, 5]; rotate_left(&mut v, 2); v == vec![3, 4, 5, 1, 2] }

hints: For sum_vec: use .iter().sum() or a fold
For find_max: use .iter().max().copied() to get Option<i32> instead of Option<&i32>
For remove_duplicates: use a HashSet to track seen values, or use Vec::contains
For rotate_left: use slice.rotate_left(n) - it's built in! Or implement manually with split_at
Remember to handle edge cases like empty slices
